tasks.task: Consider adding shiitake mushrooms to the farming strategy.
subtasks: Research the potential market demand for shiitake mushrooms.
Explore different cultivation methods for shiitake mushrooms (e.g., logs, sawdust blocks, enriched substrate bags).
Understand the optimal growing conditions for shiitake mushrooms (e.g., type of hardwood logs, temperature, humidity).
Learn about the growth cycle of shiitake mushrooms (e.g., inserting spawn, drilling holes, mycelium spread, fruiting cycles).
Determine the space requirements and adaptability of shiitake mushroom farming for your farm (e.g., small-scale, urban grower-friendly).
Learn about the sustainability aspects of shiitake farming (e.g., restoring soil health, ecological benefits).
Identify potential markets for shiitake mushrooms (e.g., farmers markets, restaurants, organic stores, packaged food products).
Calculate the potential yield and revenue from shiitake mushroom farming (e.g., 1,000 pounds per acre annually, $ tens of thousands).
Assess the labor requirements and ongoing costs of shiitake mushroom farming.

tasks.task: Evaluate the potential of shiitake mushrooms as a high-value crop with diversification benefits.
subtasks: Compare the profitability of shiitake mushrooms to traditional crops (e.g., three to four times higher price, lower labor requirements).
Consider the environmental benefits of shiitake mushroom farming (e.g., sustainable solution, breaks down organic material, enriches the environment).
Determine the demand growth trend for shiitake mushrooms (e.g., over 10% annually, no signs of slowing down).

tasks.task: Determine the steps for starting a shiitake mushroom farm.
subtasks: Source the necessary equipment and materials (e.g., hardwood logs, spawn, farming tools).
Set up a controlled environment or suitable growing space (e.g., small-scale indoor farm, outdoor logs).
Train on the cultivation process (e.g., drilling, inserting spawn, monitoring growth).
Develop distribution channels for shiitake mushrooms (e.g., local farmers markets, direct to restaurants, online sales).
